children.name: bureaucracy
children.definition: /bjʊəˈrɒkrəsiǁ-ˈrɑː-/  a complicated, official system in which there are a lot of rules and processes that you have to complete, especially one that employs a lot of people: bộ máy quan liêu
examples: ▪The EU bureaucracy in Brussels has grown in size and authority.
Bộ máy quan chức EU tại Brussels đã phát triển về quy mô và thẩm quyền.
▪ We need less bureaucracy in the school system - teachers should be allowed to make more decisions.
Chúng ta cần ít quan liêu hơn trong hệ thống trường học - giáo viên nên được phép đưa ra nhiều quyết định hơn.

children.name: bureaucratic
children.definition: /ˌbjʊərəˈkrætɪk◂/  involving a lot of complicated official rules and processes:
examples: ▪The procedure for getting funding approval is so bureaucratic!
Thủ tục xin phê duyệt tài chính quá quan liêu!
bureaucratic nightmare official system that is extremely complicated and annoying ác mộng quan chức
▪ Trying to enforce the law regulating the length of passenger buses has been a bureaucratic nightmare
Cố gắng thi hành luật quy định chiều dài của xe buýt chở khách đã là một cơn ác mộng quan liêu..

children.name: to be in charge of an activity or group of people
lead
children.definition: /liːd/  to be the person with responsibility for a large group or team that is working together on an important activity:
examples: dần đầu
▪ The drug raid was led by top officers.
▪ Dr Jenkins leads a team of researchers at the Plant Institute.
▪ A group of 80 planes, led by Lieutenant Commander Egusha, was on its way to attack.

children.name: head
children.definition: /hed/  if you head a company or activity, you are in charge of it: đứng đầu
examples: ▪ Levy headed an investigation into the fund mismanagement.
▪ The program is headed by an expert in teaching gifted and talented children.
head upAmerican informal đứng đầu
▪ Heading up the investigation into the crash is Officer Frank Foyle.

children.name: supervise
children.definition: /ˈsuːpəʳvaɪz, ˈsjuː-ǁˈsuː-/  to be in charge of agroupof workers or students and be responsible for making sure that they do their work properly, especially by being with them to give instructions, answer questions etc:
examples: quản lí, giám sát
▪ At work, she supervises a production team of fifteen.
▪ All volunteers are supervised by a qualified nurse.
▪ The teacher’s duties that morning included supervising the before-school reading program.
supervision/ˌsuːpəʳˈvɪʒən, ˌsjuː-ǁˌsuː-/ [uncountable noun] sự giám sát
▪ We work under the Chief Engineer’s supervision.
▪ Children of this age do not need constant supervision.

children.name: run
children.definition: /rʌn/  to be the person who makes the important decisions about what will happen in a business, organization, country etc:
examples: điều hành
▪ She runs a company called Sunshine Holidays.
▪ a drug counselling service that is run by ex-addicts
▪ Who really runs the country - the elected government or big business?
well/badly/poorly etc run điều hành tốt, tệ, kém
▪ The voting process was smooth and, for the most part, well-run.
state-runrun by the government nhà nước (Điều hành)
▪ a state-run mental hospital

children.name: be in charge
children.definition: /biː ɪn ˈtʃɑːʳdʒ/  if you are in charge of an activity or agroupof people, you are the person who has theauthorityto control what happens, tell other people what to do etc:
examples: phụ trách, chịu trách nhiệm
▪ He’s the captain. He’s in charge, so he’s responsible for anything that happens.
be in charge of chịu trách nhiệm vị trí
▪ Who’s the officer in charge of the investigationbe in charge of doing something
▪ As senior supervisor, she is in charge of training new employees.
put somebody in charge được đưa lên chức
▪ Two years after joining the police force, he was put in charge of the department’s records.

children.name: manage
children.definition: /ˈmænɪdʒ/  to be in charge of a business, especially one that is owned by someone else: quản lí
examples: ▪ My husband manages a mill, 200 miles north of Bombay.
▪ Managing four pizza outlets is extremely hard work.
▪ The family business was skilfully managed by her elder brother, Michael.

children.name: oversee
children.definition: /ˌəʊvəʳˈsiː/  formal to be in charge of a group of workers, especially when this involves planning and organizing what they should do rather than being with them or giving instructions to them directly: giám sát
examples: ▪ Team leaders and project managers oversee groups of programming staff.
▪ Administrators oversee the testing of students, to place them in the appropriate classes.

children.name: when sth is organized so that it works well
well-organized
children.definition: alsowell-organisedBritish /ˌwel ˈɔːʳgənaɪzd/  organized in a careful and thorough way, so that everything works very well:
examples: được tổ chức tốt
▪ The exhibition was very well organized.
Cuộc triễn lãm được tổ chức tốt.
▪ Both candidates ran effective well-organized campaigns.
Cả hai thí sinh đều điều hành hiệu quả những chiến dịch tổ chức tốt.
▪ A well-organized network of women’s groups has led the call for equal rights.
Mạng lưới các nhóm phụ nữ có tổ chức tốt đã kêu gọi quyền bình dẳng.

children.name: well-run U
children.definition: well-run/ˌwel ˈrʌn/  a business or organization that is well-run is efficient because of good management and organization:
examples: được điều hành, vận hành tốt
▪ The Klausner is a comfortable well-run hotel.
Klausner là khách sạn được quản lý tốt
▪ The city’s transportation system is clean, safe, and well run.
Hệ thống giao thông của thành phố sạch,an toàn và được điều hành tốt

children.name: organized
children.definition: alsoorganisedBritish /ˈɔːʳgənaɪzd/  arranged in a way that iseffectiveand likely to besuccessful:
examples: ▪ Tonight after supper we want to have a more organized discussion.
▪ Bernstein was convinced that an organized effort had been made to conceal the facts of the case.
▪ Anti-war dissent erupted into organized demonstrations several times in the Johnson administration.

children.name: structured
children.definition: /ˈstrʌktʃəʳd/  information, methods, or systems that are structured are organized so that they have a clear and carefully organized structure that is easy to use or understand:
examples: có cấu trúc
▪ a structured learning plan
Kế hoạch học tập có cấu trúc
▪ The situation has made us aware of the need for a more structured approach to dealing with prisoners’ problems.
Tình hình làm chúng tôi ý thức hơn nhu cầu về cách tiếp cận có cấu trúc hơn để đối phó với các vấn đề tù nhân.
well-structured : kết cấu tốt
▪ Here are some steps for creating a well-structured document.
Đây là các bước để tạo nên một tài liệu có kết cấu tốt.
highly structured :kết cấu cao
▪ The social workers’ home visits are highly structured, with specific goals and learning objectives.
Các chuyến thăm nhà những người lao động xa họi có tính kết cấu cao với mục tiêu rõ ràng và mục đích học hỏi

children.name: well-ordered
children.definition: /ˌwel ˈɔːʳdəʳd◂/  a well-ordered place, organization, way of life etc has been carefully organized so that nothing goes wrong, nothing unexpected happens, and everything is where it should be:
examples: ngăn nắp,có trật tự tốt
▪ Mary has such a well-ordered household - it makes ours look like total chaos.
Mary có một gia đình có trật tự tốt , nó khiến gia đình chúng ta trông như mớ hỗn loạn tổng hợp
▪ The town was a neat, well-ordered, red brick town dotted with trees.
Đó là một thị trấn gạch đỏ gọn gàng ngăn nắp với rải rác nhiều cây.

children.name: sb who always organizes their work, life etc well
organized
children.definition: alsoorganisedBritish /ˈɔːʳgənaɪzd/
examples: có trật tự, ngăn nắp, gọn gàng
▪ In order to do this job well, you have to be very organized.
Để làm tốt công việc này bạn phải cực kì ngăn nắp.
well-organized : bố trí tốt
▪ Well-organized troops have succeeded in recapturing the town.
Việc bố trí tốt quân sĩ đã thành công giành lại thị trấn.

children.name: businesslike
children.definition: /ˈbɪznɪs-laɪk, ˈbɪznəs-laɪk/  someone who is businesslike deals with people effectively and does not waste time on things that are not important:
examples: có khả năng tổ chức tốt
▪ Ted was friendly but businesslike and very much in charge.
Ted thì thân thiện nhưng có khả năng tổ chức tốt và đảm nhiệm nhiều vị trí.
▪ Gates gave a brief, businesslike explanation of his plans for the company.
Gates đưa ra bản tóm tắt kế hoạch tổ chức cho công ty.
▪ The representatives were serious businesslike diplomats who disliked small talk.
Đại diện là người có bằng cấp tổ chức cao và ghét nói nhỏ.

children.name: together
children.definition: /təˈgeðəʳ/ informaluse this about someone who always thinksclearlyand does things in asensible, organized way that you admire:
examples: có tổ chức
▪ You’ll have to be a bit more together when you have kids.
Bạn cần có tính tổ chức hơn khi có con.
▪ Rosie’s a really together person - she’ll be great as the coordinator.
Rosie là người có tính tổ chức , cô ấy sẽ là một cộng sự tuyệt vời.

children.name: the job or skill of being a manager
management
children.definition: /ˈmænɪdʒmənt/  the job or skill of being a manager::
examples: quản lí, điều hành, quản trị
▪ Val has finished college and is looking for a job in management.
Val vừa tốt nghiệp trường đại học và đang kiếm một công việc quản lí
▪ a course aimed at improving management skills
Khóa học này nhằm mục tiêu cải thiện những kĩ năng quản lí
good/bad management:
▪ The failure of many small businesses is caused by bad management.
Thất bại của nhiều doanh nghiêp nhỏ gây ra bởi việc quản lí tệ
managementnoun
[ U ] the control and organization of something
_The company has suffered from several years of bad management.
_There is a need for stricter financial management.
_a management training scheme

children.name: managerial
children.definition: /ˌmænɪˈdʒɪəriəl◂, ˌmænəˈdʒɪəriəl◂/connected with being a manager - use this about the jobs that managers do or the skills that they need:
examples: quản trị , quản lí
▪ This is her first managerial job.
Đây là công việc quản việc quản lí đầu tiên của cô ấy
▪ This is the biggest crisis of his managerial career.
Đây là sự khủng hoảng lớn nhất trong sự nghiệp quản lí của anh ấy
▪ Managerial skills and technical expertise are often in short supply.
Các kĩ năng quản lí và sự thông thạo kĩ thuật thường là sự

children.name: sb who organizes their work, life etc badly
disorganized
children.definition: /dɪsˈɔːʳgənaɪzd/
examples: bừa bộn
▪ Graham’s far too disorganized to be a good teacher.
Graham quá bừa bộ để có thể trở thành một giáo viên tốt.
▪ I’m sorry I’m so disorganized - I just haven’t had time to get everything ready.
Xin lỗi mình hơi bừa bộn, Tôi chỉ là không có thời gian để dọn dẹp mọi thứ.
completely/hopelessly disorganized : bừa bộn một cách
hoàn toàn/ vô vọng
▪ It’s no use asking her to do anything - she’s completely disorganized.
Chẳng ích gì khi nhờ cô ta bất cứ việc gì, cô ta bừa bộn một cách hoàn toàn
disorganized,UK usuallydisorganisedadjective thiếu tổchức;thiếu trật tự; bát nháo
not good at planning or organizing things
_He's impossible to work for - he's so disorganized.

children.name: not very (well) organized
children.definition: /ˌnɒt veri (wel) ˈɔːʳgənaɪzd/  especially spoken use this to say that someone does not organize their work, life etc very well. Not very organized is not as strong as disorganized.:
examples: không ngăn nắp
▪ He’s a nice guy, but he’s not very organized and he forgets a lot of things.
Anh ta là một chàng trai dễ thương nhưng anh ta không ngăn nắp và quên rất nhiều thứ.
▪ I’m not a very organized person - maybe you should ask somebody else to make the arrangements.
Tôi là người không ngăn nắp lắm, có thể bạn nên nhờ ai sắp xếp hộ.

children.name: sb hasn’t got it together
children.definition: somebody hasn’t got it together/somebody doesn’t have it together/ somebody ˌhæzənt gɒt ɪt təˈgeðəʳǁ-gɑːt-, somebody ˌdʌzənt hæv ɪt təˈgeðəʳ/ informal use this about someone who has not organized their work, life etc in a sensible way and therefore has been unable to be successful:
examples: không có tổ chức đủ để
▪ He hasn’t got it together enough to go out and get a job.
Anh ta không làm việc có tổ chức đủ để ra ngoài và có được một công việc.
▪ Kim has to do all the wedding planning, because her fiancé just doesn’t have it together.
Kim phải lên tất cả kế hoạch cho đám cưới vì hôn phu của cô ấy không có tính tổ chức.

children.name: when sth is not organized well
badly organized
children.definition: alsobadly organisedBritish /ˌbædli ˈɔːʳgənaɪzd/  not well organized - use this abouteventsoractivitiesthat are not successful, because they have not been planned well:
examples: talk about events, activities
tổ chức kém
▪ The festival was very badly organized - nobody seemed to know what they were doing.
Lễ hội tổ chức rất kém và dường như chẳng ai biết họ đang làm gì.
▪ There was widespread criticism that the relief operation was slow and badly organized.
Nhũng lời chỉ trích lan rộng về việc cứu trợ chậm trễ và được tổ chức kém

children.name: disorganized
children.definition: also disorganised British /dɪsˈɔːʳgənaɪzd/  not arranged according to any kind of order or plan:
examples: bừa bộn,lộn xộn
▪ She gave a long disorganized speech that left everyone confused.
Cô ấy đưa ra bài phát biểu lộn xộn khiến mọi người nhầm lẫn.
totally/completely disorganized : hoàn toàn lộn xộn
▪ Her files were completely disorganized - she could never find anything she wanted.
Các dữ liệu của cô ta hoàn toàn lộn xộn, cô ta chẳng bao giờ tìm được thứ mình muốn.
▪ a totally disorganized rescue effort
Nỗ lực cứu chữa hoàn toàn lộn xộn.
disorganized,UK usuallydisorganisedadjective
badly planned and without order
_The whole conference was totally disorganized – nobody knew what they were supposed to be doing.

children.name: badly run U
children.definition: badly run/ˌbædli ˈrʌn/  a business or organization that is badly run produces bad results because it is badly managed or organized:
examples: điều hành kém
▪ The company is not badly run, but it still has not made a profit.
Công ty được điều hành không kém nhưng nó vẫn chẳng thu được lợi nhuận.
▪ Critics say that the mayor’s office is badly run and corrupt.
Critics nói rằng văn phòng thị trưởng được điều hành kém và sắp sụp đổ.

children.name: be a mess /be a shambles X
children.definition: be a mess/be a shambles/biː ə ˈmes, biː ə ˈʃæmbəlz/ informal if a situation or event is a mess or a shambles, it is very badly organized or badly controlled, and nothing good or useful is being achieved:
examples: mớ hỗn độn
▪ The social security system in this country is a mess.
Hệ thống an ninh xã hội ở quốc gia này là một mớ hỗn độn.
a complete/hopeless etc mess : mớ hỗn độn hoàn toàn / vô vọng
▪ The whole conference was a complete mess from start to finish.
Cả hội nghị là một mớ hỗn độn hoàn toàn từ khi bắt đầu đến lúc kết thúc.
in a mess/shambles: trong mớ hỗn độn
▪ The prolonged war has left the nation’s economy in a shambles.
Cuộc chiến kéo dài đã để lại nền kinh tế của quốc gia trong một mớ hỗn độn.

children.name: in disarray
children.definition: /ɪn ˌdɪsəˈreɪ/  if agroupsuch as a political party is in disarray, it is disorganized and no longer effective, especially because the people who belong to it cannot agree with each other and cannot work together:
examples: sự xáo trộn, hỗn loạn
▪ The defeated army retreated in disarray.
Quân đội bị đánh bại rút lui trong tình trạng hỗn loạn.
in complete/total etc disarray : hoàn toàn xáo trộn, hỗn loạn
▪ The Democrats were in complete disarray after last year’s disastrous elections.
Các Đảng vien đảng dân chủ hoàn toàn hỗn loạn sau cuộc bầu cử thảm họa năm ngoái.
throw something into disarray
make it become disorganized
xáo trộn cái gì
▪ The chairman’s resignation threw the organization into disarray.
Sự từ chức của giám đóc đã xáo trộn toàn bộ tổ chức
